intro: Coccoloba nivea, commonly known as the snowflake coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, giving it its common name. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, which are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Coccoloba nivea is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its showy flowers and unique foliage.
